fields.description:
1. When typing a search term into a livesearch box, initial results matching the first term are dynamically displayed.
2. When beginning to type a second search term and observe that the results are not further filtered according to the second search term. In fact, the search results are not updated at all, the list remains exactly the same as was generated in the first step.
fields.summary: Livesearch does not further refine searches using after entered space terms

fields.description:
We upgraded to version 4.3.7 and now the related labels macro has stopped working.

The labels themselves are functioning correctly but the related labels have stopped appearing on the pages. This used to work prior to the upgrade.
fields.summary: Related Labels macro broken

fields.description:
We have fixed a vulnerability in our version of Xwork. In specific circumstances, attackers can use this vulnerability to execute Java code of their choice on systems that use these frameworks. The attacker needs to be able to access the Confluence web interface. A valid user account is not required to exploit this vulnerability.

The vulnerability affects all versions of Confluence up to and including 5.1.4.

No other Atlassian products are affected.

*For more information on this issue, including full instructions on patches and workarounds, please see the security advisory [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Security+Advisory+2013-08-05]*.

Our thanks to Reginaldo Silva who reported this vulnerability.
fields.summary: OGNL double evaluation in atlassian-xwork

fields.description:
After applying the patch for CONF-30221, login redirects can contain a $\{originalurl} parameter, instead of the original URL that requires a login.

If you have configured all of the below:

# allowed anonymous access in global permissions
# allowed anonymous view in space permissions
# restricted some content in that space so that anonymous cannot view it.

Then any time a non-logged-in user tries to view the restricted content they will be redirected to a login page normally, but once they are logged in they will be redirected to the site homepage, not their original destination.

*Workaround*

Once the user has logged in, they should manually navigate back to the page they intended to view.
fields.summary: Redirect for login can break

fields.description:
1-Open the space
2-press button "Edit"
3-Press Button "Link", an select "Web link" tab
4-Complete Address and Link text with this:
Address: a link to a query on jira: https://company.com/issues/?jql=project%20%3D%20'ICS%20Identity'%20AND%20(issuetype%20%3D%20Story%20OR%20issuetype%20%3D%20'Tech%20Story')%20and%20fixVersion%20in%20('Identity%202.0%202013-WW19')%20and%20resolution%20%3D%20'Done'%20and%20(labels%20!%3D%20No_QA_required%20OR%20labels%20is%20EMPTY)

On Link Text a name like "Test"
5-Press button "Insert"
6-Now you have the link and if you press on it with the pointer you can see 3 options "Go to Link", "Edit" and "unlink", pressing "Go to link" you can open a new tab with the query on jira, but if you press Button "Preview" or "Save" to applying this change, the link do not work anymore.
fields.summary: Web links are turned into text when using Jira issues links

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30217].
  {panel}

When using the Space Importer in the latest Confluence OnDemand release (5.2-OD-13-1), all content ownership of the imported space is set to 'Anonymous', even if the users are present. This can be reproduced when importing a space from a standalone Confluence (tested with 5.1.4), but not when importing it from another OnDemand instance.

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Export a space from a Confluence v.5.1.4 (or use the space attached)
# Import that space via *Import Spaces* menu

h4. Expected results
Page/Blog creators or modifiers are correctly displayed
!An2.png!

h4. Actual results
Users are shown as anonymous:
!An.png!
fields.summary: Space Import causes users to show as Anonymous in metadata

fields.description:
Images, that have been uploaded to a page with such a page title, can not be used on other pages.
Example: We have a page called "1.)Test" with an image attached. If we now try to use this image at another page (e.g. using the image browser and searching for the image) "unknown attachment" is shown at this page. In the editor first everything seems to be fine, be after saving the page, this information appears.
After we remove "1.)" from the page title and try to use the image again, everything works fine.
fields.summary: Using Images from pages containing special characters in their page title doesn't work

fields.description:
Hi there,

I wish to send email notification from Confluence via an office365 SMTP email account. When I attempt to send a test email I get an error which led me to this

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Caused+by%3A+javax.mail.AuthenticationFailedException%3A+No+authentication+mechansims+supported+by+both+server+and+client

However, after attempting the downgrade of the mail jar I still am faced with problems.

I seamlessly setup mail notifications for both Stash and JIRA products via office365 email accounts and have burnt close to a day trying to get this operational for confluence.

The confluence product is next to useless for our needs without working notifications.
fields.summary: Cannot Send Confluence Email Notifications

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30207].
  {panel}

*Background of The Request*

Confluence's new JIRA issues macro remove 'dynamic" method of viewing where user could modify the sorting and column as well as decide to refresh the list whenever they need.

"Static" method of viewing JIRA issues list does not have the ability to refresh the list. It would be great if the macro could provide an option to the users regarding the refresh method.

*Implementation Suggestion*

During the list creation, macro should ask whether user want the list to be refreshed according to:

* Page refresh
* Synchronization time
fields.summary: JIRA Issues Macro Should Provide Refresh List Option for Customer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30206].
  {panel}

*Request Background*

Confluence new JIRA issues macro remove 'dynamic" method of viewing where user could modify the sorting and column as well as decide to refresh the list whenever they need.

"Static" method of viewing JIRA issues list does not have the ability to refresh the list and the documentation does not specifically inform how Confluence refresh this list.

Customer should know whether this macro use page refresh or synchronization period to refresh the list of JIRA issues rendered in the macro.
fields.summary: User Should be Informed Regarding New JIRA Issue Macro Synchronize Time

fields.description:

While looking at a space activity screen, Most Active Contributors aren't displayed.

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Enable Confluence Usage Stats plugin
# Create a couple of pages on a new space
# Go to *Space Tools > Activity*

h4. Expected result
The content created will appear under the Most Popular Content, Most Active Content and Most Active Contributors sections

h4. Actual result
Most Active Contributors section do not display any user
fields.summary: Space Activity screen fails to display Most Active Contributors
Ability to set max results for JIRA Issues Macro

fields.description:
Hi there,
I have disabled the File List blueprint in the corresponding plugin, and no File List item shows up anymore under Global Templates.

However, when I invoke the "Create" dialog, File Lists are still on the list of available items. Clicking on it results in an endless spinning wheel.

This is 100% reproducible on my end. Please note I'm still running on a local installation evaluation license, for what it matters.
fields.summary: File List blueprint shows up in Create dialog even after being disabled

h4. Steps to reproduce

The page will look fine. All the content will render okay. However, if the user attempts to remove one of the sections, both the sections will be removed.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30192].
  {panel}

The "children" macro has an "excerpt" flag which we tried to use.

It does include the excerpt to some degree as expected, but the results are different from "excerpt-include". (you need to use one of the headers options of the children macro to see what I'm referring to)

The excerpt-include macro includes everything what's written in the "excerpt" macro
Using the excerpt flag of the children macro, it includes only the first paragraph of the text in the "excerpt" macro.

Expected solution: when using the "children" macro with a header, the behavior should be the same as "excerpt-include". (in the bullet mode, it's acceptable that you need to shorten the excerpt text)

Even better would be to have different "excerpt" check boxes (or a pull-down) to allow the user to control whether he wants to get the full content of the excerpt text, or shortened to one line or paragraph.
fields.summary: Change excerpt option on the "children" macro to behave similar to the excerpt-include macro

Would love to see a feature that would allow me to upload a version controlled file to a particular Space and have it show up on multiple pages within that Space by using multiple labels. 

We currently have a hierarchy of folders within Confluence that act as a file repository. Teams looking for process flow diagrams may look in an "Accounting" sub-folder for one document and a "BI" sub-folder for another. Some files of course are relevant to each group and we'd love to double expose the same file in both locations, perhaps using labels as the mechanism. 

Uploaded files technically attach to a single location server-side, but seem to become attached to a single page within Confluence. I don't know the details for that functionality well enough to comment, but I imagine this would affect that current setup. 

Let me know if you need any further clarification and thanks for listening!

Brandon

Currently, the test resources that are used in AMPS Confluence plugin contain no spaces (other than the demo space), and only one "admin" user.

This is unlikely an ideal initial set up for most plugin developers.

I would propose to make the following changes to the test resources:
* add a new 'sysadmin' user that has confluence administrator permission
* change the current 'admin' user to have only administrator permission (revoke the confluence administrator permission)
* add a new non-admin user 'joe' or 'fred'.

Ideally the changes mentioned above are the same across all product's test resources to make it easier to write tests for cross-product plugin.

Additionally, we should also make the following changes specifically for Confluence:
* add a new space "TEST" (instead of testing against the demo space)
* add a couple of pages and blog posts to the "TEST" space, ideally with some comments.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30173].
  {panel}

h3. Why

When editing a page, a crucial feature is to be able to view the diffs of the change *before* saving the change.  

For example:
# I've updated a page with some small corrections.  (ex: north -> south and seperate -> separate).
# I've also accidentally deleted a few sentences in a different section of the page without realizing it.
# Being able to diff the changes would allow me to catch the unintentional changes before saving them

h3. How

Confluence allows viewing diffs of pages *after* they are saved (under Tools->Page History) The same diff functionality just needs to be re-used for providing a pre-save diff.

h3. Additional Notes

* Older versions of confluence (with wiki markup), MediaWiki/wikipedia, and most other top notch wiki solutions provide this functionality
* MediaWiki calls this functionality "Show Changes"
* This would also allow the possibility of avoid the multiple editor race condition:
** Editor1 makes a change, but has not saved yet
** Editor2 begins editing
** Editor1 saves
** Editor2 saves and *inadvertently rolls back Editor1's change*
** If Editor2 had been able to preview the diff before saving, they could have seen Editor1's changes in there and avoided wiping them out.
fields.summary: Allow diffing a change before saving

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30161].
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian Update, November 16 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hi all,


 Many thanks for all your votes and comments on this suggestion, and apologies for not providing you with a response in such a long period of time.


 We fully understand the frustration with this issue, and understand the difficulties involved in your users and customers not being able to easily switch between two products when they’re not registered users for both.


 As most of you are aware, the current workarounds for this issue involve opening the Confluence link either in a new browser, or an incognito window.


 This is an improvement we want to implement in the future, but it's not on our roadmap for the next 12 months. We’re instead investigating other improvements related to our permissions model, such as the behaviour of inherited page edit permissions (CONFSERVER-5095) and the ability to open up individual pages to specific users (CONFSERVER-37884) and ([CONFSERVER-7089).


 Best,
 Jenny Millman | Product Manager - Confluence Server
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

If a user (e.g. a JIRA user) is not licensed to use Confluence, they cannot view any Confluence content (from JIRA or Service Desk for instance) - even if that content is available to anonymous users. They currently have to log out before they can see the content. Customers have also asked for anonymous, read-only access for authenticated users that are not coming from a JIRA User Directory.
h3. Suggested Solution for non-Service Desk customers

We cannot allow authenticated but unlicensed users to edit anonymously accessible content, since that would mean that admins would only have to enable anonymous access to have the equivalent of an unlimited user license.
 Instead, we should allow authenticated but unlicensed users to get read-only access to confluence content with anonymous permissions.

Such users will still be locked out from parts of the application that require a licensed user, including viewing user profiles, people directories, etc, unless anonymous has been granted permission to view user profiles.
h3. Solution for JIRA Service Desk customers

Link JIRA Service Desk project to Confluence space to allow customers to have access to knowledge base in *Project Settings -> Knowledge Base*.
fields.summary: Allow unlicensed, authenticated users to have anonymous read only access

{noformat}
The root cause seems that the gadget communication is not yet supported the gzip compression on the HTTP response.  There is a [KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Creating+a+Confluence+Gadget+in+JIRA+Fails?src=search] for JIRA to use Confluence gadget, it should be the equal situation on the other way as well. 

*As a workaround solution:* Disable the "Use GZIP compression" in the [JIRA general configuration|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+JIRA+Options]
fields.summary: Internal Server Error when adding Days Remaining in Sprint Gadget into Confluence

fields.description:
Tested with 5.2-rc1:

The fix for CONF-22002 introduces a regression that pushes the system attachment actions off the right hand side of the page, even for users that have relatively large screens, and even with a base system (no plugins installed).

The attached image is from my Retina MacBook Pro with the browser window occupying the full screen (effective width 1388 px). The situation will be worse for users with smaller screens.

As the screenshot shows, the "Properties" link is only partially visible for two files, and the "Delete" link for those two files is missing entirely (unless the user scrolls past the Confluence page boundary).

Aside from the obvious aesthetic problems, this is a big deal for plugins that rely on the attachment actions column, since their capabilities will be effectively hidden for the user.
fields.summary: Some system attachment actions not visible on Tools->Attachments page

fields.description:
All links in our tables of contents that include ä ü ö - ( ) doesn't work. This probably also include other special characters. 

If you click such link the URL changes but the site doesn't jump to the correct chapter.

This bug only appears in Firefox. In IE and Chrome the links work properly.
fields.summary: Table of Contents: Links that contain ä ö ü - ( ) doesn't work (FireFox)
OnDemand monitoring can't detect failures in Confluence plugin system

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30147].
  {panel}

Scenario:

* Don & I edit a page.
* I save
* Don saves. Get a merge conflict editor page.
* Don cancels.
* A notification email detailing Don's changes even though he cancelled.

I suspect the email is sent after the first save even though the save has not yet happened (though perhaps it is on cancel of the merge).
fields.summary: Receiving notifications from a page edit that never ended up happening (related to page merges)
Content Report Table macro NPE's when page creator doesn't exist

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30145].
  {panel}

Previously, the link of the containing page is included the search results. 
This allows the user to go to the page to 
* see other related attachments, 
* to update the page containing the attachment
* to move/delete the attachments
* to amend the attachments (e.g. Gliffy diagrams).

The current search results only include the link of the space home page which is not friendly to the use cases mentioned above.
fields.summary: Unable to find the page containing the attachments using search

fields.description:
My team has recently migrated from a Confuence instance we created internally to an instance shared by a number of other teams. As part of that process I have been copying over some documentation. To copy it over I clicked edit on the first version, selected everything and pasted it into the new location in a different Confluence instance.

While editing the document in the new location I have come across a strange bug trying to add a Status item, with the error:
"There has been an error loading the macro browser. Please try again or see your system administrator."

Restarting the browser or even reloading the page and editing seems to fix the problem, but after a while it reappears.

I've attached the output from Chrome's console and a screenshot of the error.
fields.summary: Error loading macro browser

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30143].
  {panel}

If a page that has attachments is deleted, before confirming, we'll se a message saying:
{quote}There are 1 incoming link(s) to this page. These links will be broken when this page is deleted{quote}

*Feature Request:*
Can Jira's behaviour be changed to prevent broken images (links) on dependent pages?

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# create a new page with an image
# on edit mode, copy the content
# create a new page using the content from the previous page
# click Tools-> Delete on the 1st page (you'll see the dialog box saying there is 1 incoming link)
# confirm deletion
# check 2nd page. (has a "Unknown Attachment")
fields.summary: Prevent broken images when deleting a page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30140].
  {panel}

We're considering storing Ad hoc Canvas cards as page attachments, but would like the card's content to be indexed nicely.

So here's an scenario:
* I create a board on a page
* In the board, I add a few cards, containing the value 'cheese', and 'bacon'.
* The cards are saved as the page's attachment
* If search for 'cheese', I don't get a hit, because the attachment is not extracted/index

So, if there's already in core-confluence a 'PDF' extractor, it would be great if there was a JSON extractor:
* If an attachment extension is {{.json}} then parse it
* Traverse it to extract all the values (as plain string tokens)
* *Nice to have*: to handle key-pairs and indexed them as such given a pattern. For example if in the attachment I have an attribute {{cheese: "Bacon"}} it be great if I could search for "cheese:"Bacon") and get a hit.
fields.summary: Provide a JSON attachment extractor, for indexing
New parameter in user macro that shows attachments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30116].
  {panel}

In earlier versions, the JIRA issue macro had a pagination feature. This feature was removed due to observed low feature usage, in addition with our strategic focus to simplify the Confluence user interface and to keep and complex JIRA operations in JIRA. My apologies for the may customers that were quickly impacted by this, we could have done a better job in communicating this and ensuring we had understood your needs with regards to this matter. 

Since then we've received a lot of feedback to bring back pagination. Thank you for those of you who provided helpful comments below, and for those customers we have been able to speak to about this. With this in mind, we have concluded the following:

* It is very clear that the current issue limit we have is insufficient and does not meet most of your needs. 
* It is important for you to be able to see _all_ the issues requested 
* We still believe that the use case of navigating 100+ issues within inside Confluence is something that is extremely low and is something which should be done in JIRA. 
* Some of you mentioned of the importance of seeing this also in PDF exports when you share the release notes or pages with customers. 

With that in mind, what will we be doing to address this?
1. We will look at increasing the limit of the total number of visible issues
2. In addition, we will look at providing a parameter to configure this.
*Note:* You will always be limited by the total amount of issues JIRA provides, but [this setting can be changed|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ONDEMANDKB/Changing+maxResults+Parameter+for+JIRA+REST+API].
3. We will be looking at also implementing CONF-30114 (sorting) to assist with dealing with larger issue lists in Confluence. 

Thank you all for your patience in this matter, we will update this issue as we make progress. 

Sherif Mansour
Confluence Product Manager

Previous description: 
{panel}
The new JIRA issues macro does not paginate. This feature request is to help us better understand why customers want this. 
If you are going to comment on this ticket, please provide some understanding for why you want pagination. We removed this feature because we saw very low usage of it. Since then, we've had a few requests to bring it back. 

One way we could solve the majority use case is to increase the default amount of search results displayed. We are a bit hesitant to bring this back as we want to understand what it is that we are missing. If you are embedding 50/100+ issues on a page and want pagination, you probably shouldn't be doing that in Confluence, but rather the JIRA issue navigator - that is why we tell you "there are xxx more issues, open in JIRA". 

Please help us understand why you want this and some examples where you really do have lots of issues on a page that you want your end-users to read (if that is the use case)
{panel}
fields.summary: Ability to configure the maximum number of issues displayed in the JIRA issues macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30115].
  {panel}

The new JIRA issues macro released to customers does not asynchronously load JIRA issues. As a result, some pages can timeout with lots of issues. 

More description from the related issue :
Page load times tend to increase exponentially when multiple JIRA issues macros are used, even for simple queries. 

As a workaround you can limit the amount of issues returned or use dynamic render mode which appears to use caching better, but it could be improved for both modes.

To reproduce:

# Create a page
# Add a JIRA issues macro with this XML view: https://jira.atlassian.com/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/temp/SearchRequest.xml?jqlQuery=project+%3D+CONF+AND+issuetype+in+%28Bug%2C+%22New+Feature%22%2C+Improvement%29+AND+fixVersion+%3D+%224.2.2%22+AND+status+in+%28Resolved%2C+Closed%29+ORDER+BY+priority+DESC%2C+key+DESC&tempMax=200
# Save the page and monitor page load time
# Edit the page and add copy/paste the JIRA issues macro to create multiples
# Save the page and monitor page load time

Page will load times will increase exponentially, even if the same query is being returned by each macro.
fields.summary: JIRA issues macro times out pages with lots of issues
Ability to sort issues in the JIRA issues macro table

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30110].
  {panel}

(Unnecessary) parallel initialisation of I18NBeans causes heavy contention leading to significant delays in the HTTP responses.

The symptom is that most HTTP workers will be waiting for a lock on a java.util.jar.JarFile instance.

{code}
"http-127.0.0.1-8091-46" daemon prio=3 tid=0x0000000008b15000 nid=0x6bb waiting for monitor entry [0xfffffd7bc7e83000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: BLOCKED (on object monitor)
	at java.util.zip.ZipFile.getEntry(ZipFile.java:302)
	- waiting to lock <0xfffffd7bfd0efdf8> (a java.util.jar.JarFile)
	at java.util.jar.JarFile.getEntry(JarFile.java:226)
	at java.util.jar.JarFile.getJarEntry(JarFile.java:209)
...
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.getResourceAsStream(ClassLoader.java:1341)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.impl.DefaultDynamicPlugin.getResourceAsStream(DefaultDynamicPlugin.java:53)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.impl.AbstractDelegatingPlugin.getResourceAsStream(AbstractDelegatingPlugin.java:190)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.util.i18n.PluginI18NResource.getPropertyResourceAsStream(PluginI18NResource.java:24)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.util.i18n.AbstractI18NResource.getBundle(AbstractI18NResource.java:26)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.util.i18n.AbstractI18NResource.getBundle(AbstractI18NResource.java:18)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.util.i18n.I18NResourceBundlesLoader.getResourceBundles(I18NResourceBundlesLoader.java:55)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.util.i18n.DefaultI18NBean.loadPluginI18NResources(DefaultI18NBean.java:149)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.util.i18n.DefaultI18NBean.<init>(DefaultI18NBean.java:76)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.util.i18n.DefaultI18NBeanFactory.getI18NBean(DefaultI18NBeanFactory.java:70)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.util.i18n.CachingI18NBeanFactory.getI18NBean(CachingI18NBeanFactory.java:31)
{code} 

Given that it is CachingI18NBeanFactory's responsibility to cache a calculated I18NBean for a specific locale, the contention on individual JAR files is counter-productive, as in it hinders one specific thread of finishing the collection of all the i18n resources from the plugins. The suggested improvement is to only let one thread per locale produce the I18NBean and let the others wait until this is available. Thus you'd still have contention on the java.util.jar.JarFile instance level, e.g. one thread requesting the i18n resources from a plugin for English and another one requesting the i18n resources for the same plugin for German, but on a much smaller scale.
fields.summary: Improve CachingI18NBeanFactory implementation
